fields.summary: [CI][Packaging][Java] Include all modules in script that generate Arrow jars

comments.body: [~kou] I think this issue can be closed because of the changes that [~kszucs] made in this PR: [http://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10329|https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10329]

Oh, sorry. I didn't notice it.
Could you confirm there are all needed jars in the assets at https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/releases/tag/nightly-2021-05-26-0-github-java-jars ?
It seems that we need to upload not only binary(?) {{.jar}} but also {{.pom}}, {{javadoc.jar}}, {{sources.jar}} and {{tests.jar}}.
See also: https://search.maven.org/search?q=g:org.apache.arrow%20AND%20v:4.0.0 
The arrow-java-root package has {{source-release.zip}}. What is this?

[~kou] the process is only uploading the jars with the code. It is not uploading the other ones you mentioned, like the tests jars. We need to change the last step of the process to upload the ones you mentioned too.

 

Thanks for the links!

 

About the *zip* file you mentioned, I need to check what is this. I do not know its purpose.

[~kszucs] [~kou] I think that some change in the [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10329] PR make the actions stopped to generate the C++ shared lib from the Linux.

I compared the Gandiva jars in the link that Kuohei Sutou sent in this message [https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/releases/tag/nightly-2021-05-26-0-github-java-jars] with the jar of that action [https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/releases/tag/actions-411-github-jars] that was generated by that PR [https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/527c346229f97537dfa51f64dc15672654dec08b] and I in the nightly build one, it just contains the *macOS* shared libraries.

 

I could not find which change make it happens, I will take a deep look on it. Do you have any idea about it?
Sorry, it is probably a copy issue. I’m going to take a look. We should also check the final bundled jars on both platform so we can avoid this bundling problem again.
